title: Virgil van Dijk warns Liverpool teammates after Man City's 'surprising' defeat to Wolves
text:

Virgil van Dijk has admitted he was "surprised" that Manchester City slipped up against Wolves - but warned they will bounce back.

Liverpool opened up an eight point gap at the top of the Premier League as Adama Traore netted twice at the Etihad Stadium to stun the winners of the last two titles.

And Liverpool's Dutch centre back van Dijk was left dumbfounded by City's failure to pick up a point at home.

“I didn’t expect that, of course,” van Dijk told Sky Sports .

“Everyone expected a difficult game for City, but City at home but it doesn’t happen much that they don’t even score one goal at home.

(Image: Offside via Getty Images)

“A great performance from Wolves, you have to give credit to them but you know the situation, you can’t really say much about it.

“They will try to bounce back from it and until then we’ve just got to focus on our international football of course.”

The Reds had, just over 24 hours earlier, managed to avoid dropping points for the first time in the league this season as James Milner's last gasp penalty gave them a 2-1 victory over Leicester .

(Image: PETER POWELL/EPA-EFE/REX)

Van Dijk was asked whether the Reds will run City close this year, the Netherlands international reckons his side still need to improve further despite a 100 per cent collection of points.

"We tried last year and unfortunately Man City was just a little bit better,” van Dijk said.

“So far we have been getting the points.

“There’s always room for improvement in our game and, what I said already before, I think we should just focus on the games ahead of us and don’t look at any gaps or any points difference between us and the others, us and City.

“There are a lot of busy periods coming up as well, obviously with December, January.

“Anything can happen still.”
description: Man City suffered a shock 2-0 defeat to Wolves on Sunday to give Liverpool an eight point lead at the top of the Premier League
